intro: Ixiolirion ferganicum, commonly known as the Fergana lily, is a perennial herb native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Liliaceae and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has strap-like leaves and produces showy, bell-shaped flowers in late spring. Ixiolirion ferganicum is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
